sponsor.partnerMessage: Building a great product, solution, or technology is just one part of the equation. Fuel gives startups the training necessary to become enterprise ready. Learn more here.

posts.title: The Howard To Offer Prime Access To Greenway
posts.content:
With trails influencing development patterns in Northwest Arkansas, Bentonville is merging the worlds of commuting and recreation with urban design and architecture. 

  • Super central: The Howard is a mixed-use, modern living building under construction in Bentonville on SE 2nd St backed up to the Razorback Greenway, slated to be complete this summer. The building is primed to offer the ultimate luxury apartment living in the center of Bentonville life. 
  • On the trail: There have been thousands of multifamily units built within the last five years in NWA that are within one mile of a trailhead, giving residents instant access to more than 250 miles of trails. The Howard is in an unrivaled area with unparalleled access to the Greenway. 

Click HERE for more.

posts.title: Amazeum To Host Its 7th Birthday Party
posts.content:
The Scott Family Amazeum is celebrating its 7th birthday on Friday (July 15) all day long, and you’re invited! 

  • A wool party: The birthday theme is based on the traditional seventh-anniversary gift of wool, so guests can experience a variety of pop-up activities like felting, finger knitting, and painting with yarn. And for extra holly fun, the Amazeum will host the Barn Yard Buddies Petting Zoo and demonstrations from the NWA Weavers Guild. 
  • For everyone: The Amazeum is part children’s museum, part science center, and part maker space, providing experiences designed for adults as well as children and families. All the birthday activities on Friday will be included with general admission to the museum. 

Learn more HERE!

posts.title: Walmart to Purchase 4,500 Canoo Electric Delivery Vehicles
posts.content:
In April, NASA selected Canoo vehicles for the first lunar landing in 50 years. Now, Walmart has signed an agreement to purchase 4,500 all-electric delivery vehicles with the option to purchase up to 10,000 units. 

  • Clean delivery: Walmart is starting its purchases with the Lifestyle Delivery Vehicle (LDV), which will be used to deliver online orders sustainably, contributing to Walmart's goal to achieve zero emissions by 2040. 
  • In the works: Headquartered in Bentonville, Canoo has engineered the LDV for high-frequency stop-and-go deliveries and speedy vehicle-to-door drop-off, including grocery and food/meal delivery. The LDV is expected to hit the streets in 2023, but Canoo and Walmart have plans to kick off advanced deliveries to refine and finalize vehicle configuration. 

Learn more HERE.

posts.title: Time For Booking Late Summer Trips
posts.content:
Who out there hasn’t planned their summer trip yet? It’s time! 

  • Get booking: We get last-minute planning. We do. But if you wait much longer, your summer vacation could cost a small fortune! So it’s buying time, and Fare Flight NWA has a few good deal suggestions for flying out of Northwest Arkansas National Airport before the school year starts up again to help you out. 
  • Trips: As of yesterday, you can go to Chicago July 29-August 2 for $315, Denver July 30-August 2 for $178, Tampa August 5-8 for $203, Fort Lauderdale July 28-31 for $319, Nashville August 4-7 for $128, and Atlanta July 28-31 for $318. 

Read the Fare Flight story HERE.

posts.title: Arkansas Enduro Series Comes To Fayetteville This Weekend
posts.content:
The Arkansas Enduro Series is coming to Centennial Park in Fayetteville this weekend, and online registration closes today at 8p. 

  • The series: Enduro is a competition, party, spectating event, and family fun with music, food, and beer! The racing combines multiple aspects of mountain bike disciplines and required terrain adaptability. Fayetteville’s event is the third of five events in the series. 
  • The races: Racers in the series earn points during races, and the Series Overall Points will be decided by the best 3 out of five races in each category. There will be “Flavor of Enduro” races on Friday for no series points for people who want a taste, and the series races for points and all skill levels will be on Saturday.

Learn more HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Wednesday night: There will be live music, food trucks, and world-class craft beer at Core Brewing & Distillery tonight, and dogs are welcome!
  • Rezoned: The former Hi-Way Inn in Fayetteville is ready for redevelopment. 
  • Trails: The Northwest Arkansas Regional Planning Commission is seeking feedback on the NWA Regional Bicycle and Pedestrian Master Plan.
  • Inside look: Read the story behind the restoration of the bank on the Fayetteville Square. 
  • Hops: Bentonville Brewing Company is crafting a new recipe for the nonprofit Soldiers’ Angels. 
  • Put it out there: Have a story? We have room in the newsletter for you! Check out our deals HERE.
